Package com.atakmap.android.location.framework

Interface Location

  • public interface Location
    Interface for implementation of a Location that can be provided by a LocationProvider.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double getBearing()
      The heading in degrees magnetic or Double.NaN if not known.
      double getBearingAccuracy()
      The accuracy of the bearing if known otherwise NaN if the accuracy is unknown.
      LocationDerivation getDerivation()
      Derivation Method for the particular location event.
      long getLocationDerivedTime()
      The time in milliseconds since EPOCH for the reported location time or -1 if not supported.
      GeoPoint getPoint()
      The geopoint representing the point including latitude, longitude, altitude in meters MSL (set to Double.NaN if not known), and CE/LE (set to Double.NaN if not known).
      java.lang.String getReliabilityReason()
      The human readable reason for the reliability score.
      int getReliabilityScore()
      Reliability is based on additional notions of if spoofing or jamming has been detected and is a confidence score from 0 to 100 where 100 is considered perfect reliability.
      double getSpeed()
      The speed in meters per second or Double.NaN if not known.
      double getSpeedAccuracy()
      The accuracy of the speed in meters per second if known otherwise NaN if the accuracy is unknown.
      boolean isValid()
      The validity of the location as provided by the location provider.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocationDerivedTime

        long getLocationDerivedTime()
        The time in milliseconds since EPOCH for the reported location time or -1 if not supported.
        Returns:
        the reported location derived time.

      • getPoint

        @NonNull
GeoPoint getPoint()
        The geopoint representing the point including latitude, longitude, altitude in meters MSL (set to Double.NaN if not known), and CE/LE (set to Double.NaN if not known).
        Returns:
        the latitude in decimal degrees

      • getBearing

        double getBearing()
        The heading in degrees magnetic or Double.NaN if not known.
        Returns:
        the heading

      • getBearingAccuracy

        double getBearingAccuracy()
        The accuracy of the bearing if known otherwise NaN if the accuracy is unknown. Returns the estimated bearing accuracy in degrees of this location at the 68th percentile confidence level. This means that there is 68% chance that the true bearing at the time of this location falls within getBearing() ()} +/- this uncertainty.
        Returns:
        the accuracy of the bearing

      • getSpeed

        double getSpeed()
        The speed in meters per second or Double.NaN if not known.
        Returns:
        the speed in meters per second

      • getSpeedAccuracy

        double getSpeedAccuracy()
        The accuracy of the speed in meters per second if known otherwise NaN if the accuracy is unknown. Returns the estimated speed accuracy in meters per second of this location at the 68th percentile confidence level. This means that there is 68% chance that the true speed at the time of this location falls within getSpeed() ()} +/- this uncertainty.
        Returns:
        the accuracy of the speed in meters per second

      • getReliabilityScore

        int getReliabilityScore()
        Reliability is based on additional notions of if spoofing or jamming has been detected and is a confidence score from 0 to 100 where 100 is considered perfect reliability. A score of zero might be obtained if the location is considered valid but contains invalid values.

      • getReliabilityReason

        @NonNull
java.lang.String getReliabilityReason()
        The human readable reason for the reliability score. This is freetext and used to further amplify the meaning of the reliability score.
        Returns:
        the human readable reason.

      • getDerivation

        @NonNull
LocationDerivation getDerivation()
        Derivation Method for the particular location event.

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        The validity of the location as provided by the location provider. The location provider is responsible for determining what would identify this location as valid. For example if an NMEA derived location is not within a certain period of time, it is no longer marked as valid.
